00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 contextABCD.pl - Contexts for matching problems.
00020 
00021 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00022 
00023 Implements contexts for string-valued answers especially
00024 for matching problems (where you match against A, B, C, D,
00025 and so on).
00026 
00027 There are two contexts defined here,
00028 
00029     Context("ABCD");
00030     Context("ABCD-List");
00031 
00032 The second allows the students to enter lists of strings,
00033 while the first does not.
00034 
00035 You can add new strings to the context as needed (or remove old ones)
00036 via the Context()->strings->add() and Context()-strings->remove()
00037 methods, eg.
00038 
00039     Context("ABCD-List")->strings->add(E=>{},e=>{alias=>"E"});
00040 
00041 Use string_cmp() to produce the answer checker(s) for your
00042 correct values.  Eg.
00043 
00044     ANS(string_cmp("A","B"));
00045 
00046 when there are two answers, the first being "A" and the second being "B".
00047 
00048 =cut
00049 
00050 loadMacros("MathObjects.pl","contextString.pl");
00051 
00052 sub _contextABCD_init {
00053   my $context = $main::context{ABCD} = Parser::Context->getCopy("String");
00054   $context->{name} = "ABCD";
00055   $context->strings->are(
00056     "A" => {},
00057     "B" => {},
00058     "C" => {},
00059     "D" => {},
00060    );
00061 
00062   $context = $main::context{'ABCD-List'} = $context->copy;
00063   $context->operators->redefine(',', from => "Full");
00064   $context->strings->add("NONE"=>{});
00065 
00066   main::Context("ABCD");  ### FIXME:  probably should make author select context explicitly
00067 }
00068 
00069 1;
